Legal_Issue: Application of quantitative vs. qualitative residence test; adequacy of reasons
Evidence_Assessment: Residence duration and pattern, inconsistent estimates
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate compliance with residence requirement
Credibility_Factor: Reasonableness of Citizenship Judge's conclusion despite inconsistencies
Legal_Rule: Citizenship Judges must apply either quantitative or qualitative residence test, not both; reasons must be transparent and intelligible
Procedural_Issue: Alleged blending of tests and inadequate reasoning
Grounds_for_Claim: Error in legal reasoning and application of residence test
Key_Evidence_Considered: Physical presence data, hypothetical qualitative assessment
Applicant_Challenge: Minister challenged approval of citizenship application
Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence on residence
Remedy_Sought: Judicial intervention to reverse citizenship approval
Authority: Citizenship Judge, Federal Court on appeal
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet physical presence requirement
Governing_Rule: Quantitative physical presence test applies; qualitative test not required if quantitative met
